content.text: Let's learn how to make plans with a friend for the weekend in German. We'll plan a fun trip together!
To ask a yes/no question in German, you often start with the verb. For example, 'Du hast Pläne' (You have plans) becomes 'Hast du Pläne?' (Do you have plans?).

data.tip: The 'w' in German sounds like the English 'v'.

content.title: Proposing an Idea
content.setting: You are talking to your friend, Anna, to make plans for the weekend.

conversation_flow.title: Ask about weekend plans
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Hallo! Nein, ich habe noch keine Pläne. Warum fragst du?

conversation_flow.title: Suggest a day trip to a city
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ein Ausflug? Das ist eine super Idee! Wohin?

extract_info.city_name: Extract the name of the city from the user's message

conversation_flow.title: Suggest an activity for the trip
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Super! Nach {city_name}! Was können wir dort machen?

extract_info.activity_name: Extract the activity from the user's message, e.g., visit a museum

content.text: Great start! Now that you have an idea for the trip, let's discuss the logistics.
To say 'by train', you say 'mit dem Zug'. 'Dem' is used here because 'der Zug' is a masculine noun.

data.tip: The German 'z' sounds like 'ts' in English.

content.title: Discussing Logistics
content.setting: You continue planning the trip to {city_name} with Anna.

conversation_flow.title: Ask how to travel
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: {activity_name}? Das klingt gut! Wie kommen wir nach {city_name}?

conversation_flow.title: Suggest a time to meet on Saturday
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ja, mit dem Zug ist perfekt. Wann wollen wir uns treffen?

extract_info.meeting_time: Extract the time and day from the user's message

conversation_flow.title: Ask for her opinion on the plan

content.text: Excellent! The plan is almost complete. Let's confirm the final details.
The word 'am' is very useful! It means 'on' for days of the week ('am Samstag') and 'at' for locations ('am Bahnhof').

data.meaning: I'm excited / I'm looking forward to it

data.tip: The 'h' is soft after the long 'a' sound.

content.title: Finalizing the Plan
content.setting: You are finalizing the weekend plans with Anna.

conversation_flow.title: Confirm the time and suggest a meeting place
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Ja, genau! Also, wir fahren nach {city_name} und {activity_name}. Wo treffen wir uns?

conversation_flow.title: Express your excitement
conversation_flow.chatbot_message: Perfekt! {meeting_time} am Bahnhof. Ich freue mich schon!
